alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 10:48AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Chelan. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from snowmelt and earlier rainfall Thursday. Additional moderate to heavy rain will move into the area today through late Tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1048 AM PDT, local law enforcement reported water continuing to run high and fast in Twenty-five Mile State Park and in Twenty-five Mile Creek. Several streams and rivers in the area are at or above bankfull. Flooding is already occurring. Local rock slides will be possible along Highway 97A. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Entiat, Ardenvoir, Pine Flat Campground, Ramona Park Campground, Lake Chelan State Park, Grouse Mountain Campground, 25 Mile Creek State Park, Fox Creek Campground, Manson and Stayman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
